newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica air force pull out of flood-hit Mozambique.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica air force pull out of flood-hit Mozambique.

text.p: The South African Air Force on Friday withdrew its aircraft from Mozambique after a four-day operation to evacuate flood victims, a spokeswoman said.

Spokeswoman Laverne Machine said in a statement the air force evacuated 1,411 people and airdropped 4,500 kg (10,000 lb) of emergency medicines, food and blankets to people along the flooding Pungue, Buzi and Zambezi rivers.
"The operation has now been successfully completed," Machine said.
She said all of the aircraft, including two Oryx helicopters, a Cessna and a C130 Hercules, had been withdrawn after 150 flying hours.
The Mozambique government said on Friday it would launch an appeal for international aid on Monday to help relocate an estimated 400,000 people affected by the floods.
